chapter.title: Configure a Document
chapter.para: Set values in the pom.xml file, which is the configuration file for a document, to configure the components for a document.
You can configure the following document components:

section.title: Table of Contents and List of Tables
section.para: To suppress either the table of content from the preface and generate it in other chapters, use the nop option. In the <configuration> section for your document, add the following markup:
section.programlisting: <generateToc> appendix toc,title article/appendix nop article toc,title book title,figure,table,example,equation chapter toc,title part toc,title preface nop qandadiv toc qandaset toc reference toc,title section toc set toc,title </generateToc>
section.para: This is the default settings we use now, but I've changed the entry for preface from:

Where "nop" stands for "no operation", which just means "don't do anything for this one". We could add other rules, like: preface/section nop That would say "if the section is in a preface, don't give it a toc either", which would override the more general rule of "section toc" which says "Gives sections their own tocs).
